page.title: 03PERSONALITIES.
page.content: William of Ockham is mentioned in the special feature on the church. The first Baron King, Lord Chancellor, bought the Ockham Estate in 1711. His descendants, the Lovelaces, were Surrey landowners with special influence as builders and employers living nearby and in Ockham Park until 1941 when Mary, Countess of Lovelace died. John Donne spent several years in Pyrford Place after his runaway marriage to a cousin of the owner, Francis Wolley. Queen Elizabeth I was previously a visitor there. The Victorian author A.J.Mumby lived in Wheelers farmhouse, Pyrford for a time and wrote about the Ripley landscape. Nelson is associated with Ripley's Talbot Hotel.
